chants.title: Baye Fall Chant unplugged
chants.content: This is a recording of Baye Fall chanting recorded in Diourbel, Senegal on July 22, 2011. The Baye Falls are a sub-sect of the Mouride Islamic Brotherhood. This was recorded outside the compound of a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in Senegal.

danses.title: Down Mobile Way 1935
danses.content: Scenes of azaleas in bloom, old homes, ships at docks, and bales of cotton, barrels of turpentine, and bunches of bananas being loaded on board freighters in Mobile, Ala., depict its culture and commercial activity. Shows a panorama of Gulf, Little River, and Cedar Creek State Parks in Alabama. CCC boys work in the forests and operate tractors and graders in State Parks; picnickers eat on outdoor tables. A colored CCC boy dances. National Archives Identifier: 11662 Local Identifier: 48.31 Creator(s): Department of the Interior. Division of Motion Pictures. (? - ?) (Most Recent) From: Series : Motion Picture Film Documentation of the Diverse Activities of the Department of the Interior, compiled 1916 - 1976 * Record Group 48: Records of the Office of the Secretary of the Interior, 1826 - 2009 Level of Description: Item Type(s) of Archival Materials: Moving Images This item was produced or created: 1935 The creator compiled or maintained the series between: 1916 - 1976 Access Restriction(s): Unrestricted Use Restriction(s): Undetermined Sound Type: Sound Accession Number(s): III-NAV-193 Online Resource(s): YouTube This video is available on the U.S. National Archives' channel on YouTube. * Transcript A transcript of this video is available online as a PDF. Contributors to Authorship and/or Production of the Archival Material(s): * Department of the Interior. National Park Service. (1916 - 1933), Producer
danses.authorName: Department of the Interior. Division of Motion Pictures

danses.title: An International Study of American Roads
danses.content: This moving image includes T.H. MacDonald, Chief, Bureau of Public Roads, who introduces the picture. Reel 1 shows Government buildings in Washington, D.C.; Mount Vernon and the Mt. Vernon Memorial Highway under construction; maps showing the route followed by the touring international delegates; buses leaving Washington, D.C., and passing through Miami, Florida, and St. Simons Island, Georgia; antebellum mansions in the South; and a Black boy dancing. Reel 2 shows views of North Carolina's Great Smoky Mountains; Virginia's Natural Bridge; Philadelphia's Independence Hall; Valley Forge; the Philadelphia-Camden toll bridge; the Holland Tunnel; the New York City skyline and crowds in the city; the recently completed Empire State Building; airplanes over the George Washington Bridge; boulevards in Westchester County; the Boston Post Road to New York City; Niagara Falls; Duluth, Minnesota, and iron mines nearby; a school children's pageant honoring the delegates; a war dance performed by Sac Indians In Iowa; Chicago's Lake Shore Drive; a University of Michigan football game in Ann Arbor; the Dodge Auto plant in Detroit; and the Detroit-Windsor tunnel. Reel 3 maps the interrelation between Federal and State roads using North Carolina roads as an example. Charts depict the growth of auto registrations, 1900-1930. The moving image also shows the hand construction of roads, types of road machinery, and a concrete road under construction. In reel 4, a road bed is prepared and a dirt road graded. A picture sequence shows a car mired in dirt road in 1918, a gravel road in 1920, a bituminous road in 1925, and a concrete highway in 1930. Includes panoramic views of bridges, highways, and traffic. Reel 5 shows types of vehicles using the roads, a motel, a congested highway outside a city, a horse race, a Greyhound bus in motion, and the loading of furniture into a van. Reel 6 shows the truck transport of goods from a railroad station, livestock in trucks, the loading of vegetables into a truck, solid-tired milk trucks, highways of various widths, banked curves and guard rails, over and underpasses, roads in Indiana, Florida, and Ohio, a motorcycle police patrol, a patrolman unsnarling a traffic jam, snowplows in action, the Statue of Liberty, and the U.S. Marine Corps band. Description courtesy of the National Archives. National Archives Identifier: 7364
danses.authorName: United States. Department of Agriculture. Federal Extension Service.

metadata.title: An International Study of American Roads
metadata.content: This moving image includes T.H. MacDonald, Chief, Bureau of Public Roads, who introduces the picture. Reel 1 shows Government buildings in Washington, D.C.; Mount Vernon and the Mt. Vernon Memorial Highway under construction; maps showing the route followed by the touring international delegates; buses leaving Washington, D.C., and passing through Miami, Florida, and St. Simons Island, Georgia; antebellum mansions in the South; and a Black boy dancing. Reel 2 shows views of North Carolina's Great Smoky Mountains; Virginia's Natural Bridge; Philadelphia's Independence Hall; Valley Forge; the Philadelphia-Camden toll bridge; the Holland Tunnel; the New York City skyline and crowds in the city; the recently completed Empire State Building; airplanes over the George Washington Bridge; boulevards in Westchester County; the Boston Post Road to New York City; Niagara Falls; Duluth, Minnesota, and iron mines nearby; a school children's pageant honoring the delegates; a war dance performed by Sac Indians In Iowa; Chicago's Lake Shore Drive; a University of Michigan football game in Ann Arbor; the Dodge Auto plant in Detroit; and the Detroit-Windsor tunnel. Reel 3 maps the interrelation between Federal and State roads using North Carolina roads as an example. Charts depict the growth of auto registrations, 1900-1930. The moving image also shows the hand construction of roads, types of road machinery, and a concrete road under construction. In reel 4, a road bed is prepared and a dirt road graded. A picture sequence shows a car mired in dirt road in 1918, a gravel road in 1920, a bituminous road in 1925, and a concrete highway in 1930. Includes panoramic views of bridges, highways, and traffic. Reel 5 shows types of vehicles using the roads, a motel, a congested highway outside a city, a horse race, a Greyhound bus in motion, and the loading of furniture into a van. Reel 6 shows the truck transport of goods from a railroad station, livestock in trucks, the loading of vegetables into a truck, solid-tired milk trucks, highways of various widths, banked curves and guard rails, over and underpasses, roads in Indiana, Florida, and Ohio, a motorcycle police patrol, a patrolman unsnarling a traffic jam, snowplows in action, the Statue of Liberty, and the U.S. Marine Corps band. Description courtesy of the National Archives. National Archives Identifier: 7364
